image.altText: A flooded street in Naracoorte.

props.synopsis: The town of Naracoorte in South Australia's south-east breaks a longstanding local rainfall record, with a two-day deluge causing streets to flood as well damage to powerlines and several buildings.

title.children: Two-day deluge breaks rainfall records in SA regional town, BOM says

image.altText: A woman holds a photo at a rally against domestic violence.

props.synopsis: For the second time in as many days, domestic violence prevention campaigners rally in Adelaide calling for systemic reform in response to the recent deaths of four women, including Jodie Jewell who was shot dead at Modbury North.

title.children: Friend of shooting victim Jodie Jewell speaks out as advocates rally against domestic violence

image.altText: A masked man wearing a vest is supporting an elderly woman wearing a black coat

props.synopsis: Day one of a temporary ceasefire in the Israel-Gaza war ends with Hamas releasing about double the number of hostages previously announced by authorities and 39 Palestinian prisoners being freed from Israeli jails.

title.children: Surprise as extra hostages released on tense first day of Israel-Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: A woman looks out of the window of a plane.

props.synopsis: South Australian police have charged a woman over an alleged second attempt to murder a man who had already been left quadriplegic by an axe attack, with the man's former partner — who was charged over the earlier incident — also now in custody.

title.children: Woman arrested over alleged second attempt to murder axe attack victim as former partner extradited

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: The death of Charlie Stevens, the SA police commissioner's son, caused grief in the community that was shared by many who felt a bond with the commissioner, including many in the media.

title.children: Charlie Stevens was the 101st person to die on SA's roads this year. His death had a profound impact

image.altText: a woman smiling under the sun

props.synopsis: The Queensland government allowed its mine safety commissioner Kate du Preez to keep acting in her role after accepting a lucrative job offer from a coal giant that has multiple convictions over workplace deaths and injuries, ABC Investigations has found.

title.children: Why a mine safety commissioner's new corporate gig is raising eyebrows about lobbying rules

image.altText: Concept image of a widen road on a lower level under a large intersection with traffic going perpendicular

props.synopsis: New vision released shows the final section to be completed of the North-South Corridor upgrade as the South Australian government seeks feedback from communities.

title.children: Fresh look at 'city-defining' upgrade in one of South Australia's biggest road projects

image.altText: A fish and chip menu board

props.synopsis: State and federal consumer affairs ministers vote to implement compulsory country of origin labelling of seafood in all hospitality venues.

title.children: Restaurants will soon be required to tell you where their seafood was caught, under new country of origin rules

image.altText: A close up of a bright yellow native bee

props.synopsis: Native bee researchers are travelling overseas and interstate to find work despite there being a sizeable knowledge gap about Australia's vast array of species.

title.children: Native bee knowledge gap frustrates researchers unwilling to work for free

image.altText: Blackened bushland behind a fence.

props.synopsis: Firefighters have succeeded in containing a devastating blaze in Perth's north, but a severe weather warning has authorities on alert heading into Sunday.

title.children: 'Difficult times ahead': Firefighters contain Perth blaze but brace for 'severe' weather

image.altText: A man squats over fire damaged posessions

props.synopsis: Residents whose homes have been destroyed and lives turned upside down by a massive fire that's torn through Perth's north-east return to their properties to pick up the pieces.

title.children: Yohann Catherine and his family didn't take the Perth fire seriously. Now they have 'nothing left'

image.altText: Fahad at Red Rooster

props.synopsis: You might think all students stand equal at the doorstep of Australia’s universities. But when Fahad tried to become a doctor, he had to navigate a system that seemed to punish him.

title.children: The odds of becoming a doctor when you live west of the 'Red Rooster line'

image.altText: Young teacher Brittany Herrington standing in a colourful Year 5 classroom.

props.synopsis: "Unsustainable workloads" and children with increasingly complex needs are among the reasons why more and more teachers are considering quitting, according to a new union survey.

title.children: Young teacher racks up 20 hours a week in overtime and $17k on work expenses

image.altText: Canola crops with mountain ranges behind

props.synopsis: John Snooke says the Pacific Seeds' "garrison" canola variety's underperformance has cost him more than $70,000, but the company will not pay compensation.

title.children: A fifth of a farmer's canola crop died — then the seed company asked him to sign an NDA

image.altText: Six women and a man lined up behind each other wearing bright red costumes and painted white faces.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people use kayaks and floats to block the Port of Newcastle for 30 hours to protest coal exports and a lack of action on climate change.

title.children: Coal miners and flood victims among those paddling out to block world's largest coal port

image.altText: a person standing outdoors on a wheat farme next to machinery with storm clouds brewing and their arms up high

props.synopsis: As Western Australia sweats through the hottest November on record, eastern states are rejoicing through an extended run of stormy days.

title.children: Heavy rains mean Black Summer repeat unlikely as WA swelters through hottest November

image.altText: A composite image of three photos, including an old lady, a lady and a girl, and two girls

props.synopsis: Thirteen women and children who were among more than 200 Israelis taken hostage in the October 7 Hamas attack are returned home. Here's what we know about them.

title.children: After seven weeks in captivity, these Israelis are free. Here's what we know about them

image.altText: a group women holding two young children sitting at the airport, four of the women are arrivals from gaza

props.synopsis: Dozens of Palestinians arrive in Sydney after being granted visas by the Australian government, some of them with nothing left but their personal identification.

title.children: 'Everything is lost': After 40 days trapped in a church in Gaza, the Tarazi family is finally safe in Sydney

image.altText: Min Woo Lee watches on after completing a shot in front of the gallery

props.synopsis: Min Woo Lee rolls with Adam Scott's best punches and lands some of his own to earn a three-shot lead ahead of the Australian PGA Championship's final round.

title.children: Min Woo Lee burns off Adam Scott to take control of Australian PGA Championship

image.altText: An aerial image showing a large line of surfers standing on a beach.

props.synopsis: More than 600 surfers, including a recent shark bite survivor, have taken part in the event to honour Zac Young, killed by a shark 10 years ago at the age of 19.

title.children: Surfing community unofficially breaks world record for largest paddle-out, in memory of shark victim

image.altText: Veronica and her two young children are sitting in a playground

props.synopsis: When my daughter discovered a pink tea set abandoned at our local playground, it was the greatest treasure to have ever been unearthed. Was it hers for the taking? I wasn't so sure.

title.children: Found a discarded toy at the playground? Finders keepers, losers weepers, right?

image.altText: GOlfer John Senden winces as he completes a shot during a tournament. He's wearing a red jumper.

props.synopsis: John Senden, who won the Australian Open in 2006, says the best thing for him to do is keep playing golf after revealing he has been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.

title.children: Australian golf veteran says 'staying open' is key as he reveals Parkinson's disease diagnosis

image.altText: Australian basketballer Josh Giddey looks down the court during an NBA game as he holds the ball in his left hand.

props.synopsis: Australian basketball star Josh Giddey is being investigated by the NBA over social media claims he engaged in a relationship with a minor.

title.children: Boomers star Josh Giddey being investigated by the NBA over allegations of a relationship with a minor

image.altText: A women with dark red hair faces the camera with a somber expression on her face.

props.synopsis: Asherman's syndrome is under-diagnosed, misunderstood, and can lead to infertility. A group of mothers are campaigning for changes to protect women from a common medical procedure that can lead to a diagnosis.

title.children: This medical procedure can lead to infertility. A grassroots group is fighting for greater awareness

image.altText: A pile of apparent wreckage on a yellow barge in the middle of the sea.

props.synopsis: Water Police and Search and Rescue divers return to Melbourne's Port Phillip Bay to recover the wreckage of a plane involved in a deadly midair collision last weekend.

title.children: Police hope cameras may provide answers to fatal Port Phillip Bay plane crash

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Animated still shows a smiling lizard on a rock next to a wide-eyed turtle, inside a terrarium.

props.synopsis: Grade-school existential crises form the heart of Adam Sandler's 'remarkably tender' new kids' film.

title.children: 'Remarkably tender': Why Adam Sandler as Leo the lizard is more emotional than expected

image.altText: A man trapped inside a tunnel wears a white hard hat as he looks into a camera for a low resolution picture.

props.synopsis: Forty-one men have been stranded inside a 2-kilometre stretch of a collapsed tunnel in the Himalayas for almost two weeks. So how did they end up in there and what have conditions been like as they await a cautious rescue mission?

title.children: How did the 41 workers trapped inside a collapsed Himalayan highway tunnel survive for almost two weeks?

image.altText: mother lucy bloom standing outside randwick girls high school looking at the camera

props.synopsis: News that two schools in the city's east will be joining to go co-ed in a few years' time has split the community. It's not the first time such a move has stirred debate in Sydney.

title.children: Another of Sydney's single-sex schools is going co-ed. This mum says her child might drop out

image.altText: Coach Tony Gustavsson wearing a Matildas scarf.

props.synopsis: Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson is linked to the vacant Sweden men's job, but insists he's committed through to Australia's Paris Olympics campaign.

title.children: Coach Tony Gustavsson stresses Matildas commitment amid Sweden speculation

props.synopsis: Recent satellite images reveal that the iceberg, weighing nearly a trillion metric tonnes, is drifting quickly past the northern tip of the Antarctic Peninsula, aided by strong winds and currents.

title.children: Iceberg double the size of the ACT on the move for first time in 30 years

image.altText: Sigrid Thornton, a 64-year-old white woman with curly brown hair wearing a white blouse and black pants leans against a railing.

props.synopsis: Most Australians would know her from her screen roles, but theatre has been a drawcard for the veteran actor in recent years and she's about to take on one of her meatiest roles yet.

title.children: Sigrid Thornton's latest role is 'a marathon' and one of her biggest challenges yet

image.altText: US comedian Matt Rife on-stage in Netflix stand-up special Natural Selection.

props.synopsis: The TikTok famous comedian was ready for centre-stage with his first Netflix special, but a joke about domestic violence has caused controversy. Was it intentional?

title.children: Matt Rife is the one of the world's biggest new comics. His stand-up special immediately lost him fans

image.altText: Kids in traditional attire and face paint sit with their feet in a swimming pool. Children splash around them.

props.synopsis: In a place where the temperatures can soar above 40 degrees Celsius, children and adults alike are cheering the long-awaited return of their community pool.

title.children: For five years, kids in this community were swimming in croc-inhabited creeks. Finally, that's changed
